main event: On March 28, 1952, at approximately 05:35 GMT, an object resembling a white luminous ball the size of a dime at arm's length was observed in the sky over Albuquerque, New Mexico. It remained stationary for a period of time before moving slowly to the west and disappearing from view.
interesting points: The object had the appearance of a white luminous ball and did not leave a trail or vapor trail.
It was first observed in the north and later moved to the west before disappearing from view.
The object was self-luminous and did not produce any sound.
Weather conditions were clear at the time of the observation.
The object did not fit the description of any conventional aircraft.
sighted object: white luminous ball in the sky
